intro: Hoffmannseggella × mingaensis, commonly known as the hybrid hoffmannseggella, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface, while its flowers display a range of colors from yellow to orange. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
